title: Mira Murati
content:
{{Short description|Chief Technology Officer at OpenAI}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2023}} {{Infobox person | name = Mira Murati | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1988|12|16|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Vlorë]], [[People's Socialist Republic of Albania|Albania]] | education = [[Colby College]]
[[Dartmouth College]]
[[Pearson College UWC]] | known_for = Developing [[ChatGPT]], [[artificial intelligence ethics]] advocacy | title = [[Chief Technology Officer]] | employer = [[OpenAI]] }} '''Mira Murati''' (born 16 December 1988) is an [[Albanians|Albanian]] mechanical engineer, researcher and business executive.{{Cite web |last=Pascual |first=Manuel G. |date=2023-12-13 |title=Who is Mira Murati, one of the most influential women in the world in 2023? |url=https://english.elpais.com/technology/2023-12-13/who-is-mira-murati-one-of-the-most-influential-women-in-the-world-in-2023.html |access-date=2023-12-29 |website=EL PAÍS English |language=en-us}}{{cite web |last1=Binder |first1=Matt |title=Mira Murati: Who is the new OpenAI interim CEO? |url=https://mashable.com/article/who-is-mira-murati-openai-ceo |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231117233606/http://mashable.com/article/who-is-mira-murati-openai-ceo |archive-date=17 November 2023 |access-date=17 November 2023 |publisher=Mashable}}{{Cite web |last=Woman |first=Global |date=2023-03-10 |title=Mira Murati: The Albanian Woman Who Developed ChatGPT |url=https://globalwomanmagazine.com/mira-murati-the-albanian-woman-who-developed-chatgpt/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230710110227/https://globalwomanmagazine.com/mira-murati-the-albanian-woman-who-developed-chatgpt/ |archive-date=10 July 2023 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=Global Woman Magazine |language=en-US}} She is the [[chief technology officer]] of [[OpenAI|Open AI]], which she joined as a researcher in 2018.{{cite web |last1=Browne |first1=Ryan |date=20 November 2023 |title=Who is new interim OpenAI CEO Emmett Shear? All you need to know about the man replacing Sam Altman |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2023/11/20/who-is-emmett-shear-the-new-openai-ceo-taking-over-from-sam-altman.html |access-date=20 November 2023 |website=CNBC |language=en}} She contributes to the company's mission to "ensure that artificial general intelligence benefits all of humanity."{{Cite web |title=Ermira Murati |url=https://www.amacad.org/person/ermira-murati |access-date=2023-12-18 |website=American Academy of Arts & Sciences |language=en}}{{cite news |last1=Seetharaman |first1=Deepa |last2=Berber |first2=Jin |date=17 November 2023 |title=Sam Altman Is Out at OpenAI After Board Skirmish |work=wsj.com |publisher=The Wall Street Journal |url=https://www.wsj.com/tech/sam-altman-departs-open-ai-mira-murati-interim-ceo-41f6d51e |url-status=live |access-date=18 November 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231118000739/https://www.wsj.com/tech/sam-altman-departs-open-ai-mira-murati-interim-ceo-41f6d51e |archive-date=18 November 2023}}{{Cite web |title=About |url=https://openai.com/about |access-date=2023-12-18 |website=openai.com |language=en-US}} Writing about Murati for the 2023 [[Time 100]], Microsoft CEO [[Satya Nadella]] said "she has a demonstrated ability to assemble teams with technical expertise, commercial acumen, and a deep appreciation for the importance of mission." He went on to say "As a result Mira has helped build some of the most exciting AI technologies we’ve ever seen, including ChatGPT, DALL-E, and GPT-4."{{Cite web |date=2023-09-13 |title=2023 TIME100 Next: Mira Murati |url=https://time.com/collection/time100-next-2023/6308517/mira-murati/ |access-date=2023-12-18 |website=Time |language=en}} ==Early life and education== Murati was born on 16 December 1988{{Cite web |title=Mira Murati:The Friendly Face Heading Up Tech For ChatGPT |url=https://www.forbesindia.com/article/lifes/mira-murati-the-friendly-face-heading-up-tech-for-chatgpt/84751/1 |access-date=2023-07-03 |website=Forbes India |language=en |archive-date=3 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230703135502/https://www.forbesindia.com/article/lifes/mira-murati-the-friendly-face-heading-up-tech-for-chatgpt/84751/1 |url-status=live }} in [[Vlorë]], Albania.{{cite web |last=Morris |first=Chris |date=2023 |title=OpenAI's Mira Murati |url=https://www.fastcompany.com/90855799/6-things-to-know-about-openais-mira-murati-the-most-interesting-person-in-tech-right-now |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230306123408/https://www.fastcompany.com/90855799/6-things-to-know-about-openais-mira-murati-the-most-interesting-person-in-tech-right-now |archive-date=March 6, 2023 |access-date=January 3, 2023 |website=[[Fast Company]]}} She was 2 years old when the communist regime fell and all the uncertainty and changes that occurred in that period pushed her to be passionate about the truth that comes after the sciences, especially math. Her passion and interest for math continued throughout her school years where she participated in many Olympiads and math competitions. At the age of 16, Murati won a scholarship and went to high school at the [[Pearson College UWC|Pearson United World College of the Pacific]] on [[Vancouver Island]], [[British Columbia]], Canada, from which she graduated in 2005.[https://www.pearsoncollege.ca/wp-content/uploads/Annual_Report_2008.pdf Pearson College Annual Report] (2008){{Cite web |title=Ermira Murati {{!}} Davis UWC Scholars |url=https://www.davisuwcscholars.org/scholars/2011/m/node/2059 |access-date=2023-11-19 |website=www.davisuwcscholars.org |archive-date=16 April 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230416235629/https://www.davisuwcscholars.org/scholars/2011/m/node/2059 |url-status=live }} For her undergraduate education, Murati attended [[Colby College]] and [[Dartmouth College]].{{Cite web |last=Barath |first=Harini |year=2023 |title=ChatGPT Gets Dartmouth Talking |url=https://home.dartmouth.edu/news/2023/02/chatgpt-gets-dartmouth-talking |access-date=2023-03-07 |website=[[Dartmouth College]] |publisher= |language=en |archive-date=2023-03-07 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230307142745/https://home.dartmouth.edu/news/2023/02/chatgpt-gets-dartmouth-talking |url-status=live }}{{Cite web |title=From the Editor, Colby College |url=https://digitalcommons.colby.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1201&context=colbymagazine |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230605153600/https://digitalcommons.colby.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1201&context=colbymagazine |archive-date=2023-06-05 |access-date=2023-11-17 |website=Colby College |page=2}}{{Cite web |last=Bordoloi |first=Pritam |date=2022-05-09 |title=OpenAI gets a new president, CTO & COO in the latest rejig |url=https://analyticsindiamag.com/openai-gets-a-new-president-cto-coo-in-the-latest-rejig/ |access-date=2023-11-22 |website=Analytics India Magazine |language=en-US}} ==Career at OpenAI== Murati joined [[OpenAI]] in 2018 as a researcher, later becoming its [[chief technology officer]], leading the company's work on ChatGPT, [[DALL-E|Dall-E]], and [[OpenAI Codex|Codex]],{{cite magazine |last=Simons |first=John |date=Feb 2023 |title=Keeping AI in Check |magazine=[[TIME (magazine)|TIME]] |volume=201 |pages=60–61 |number=5/6}} while overseeing the company's research, product and safety teams.{{Cite web |date=2023-04-24 |title=Insider Q&A: OpenAI CTO Mira Murati on shepherding ChatGPT |url=https://apnews.com/article/openai-cto-mira-murati-chatgpt-gpt4-dalle-0e701dd406b4a1a2d625e779de0c5164 |access-date=2023-11-17 |website=AP News |language=en |archive-date=26 April 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230426225614/https://apnews.com/article/openai-cto-mira-murati-chatgpt-gpt4-dalle-0e701dd406b4a1a2d625e779de0c5164 |url-status=live }} Murati is responsible for overseeing the technical advancements and direction of OpenAI's various projects, including the development of advanced AI models and tools. Her work has been instrumental in the building, progress and deployment of some of OpenAI's most notable products such as the Generative Pretrained Transformer (GPT) series of language models. Her work also includes pushing the boundaries of machine learning while advocating for the responsible and ethical use of AI technologies. On 17 November 2023, Murati briefly took over as interim chief executive officer of OpenAI following the abrupt removal of [[Sam Altman]].{{Cite web |title=OpenAI announces leadership transition |url=https://openai.com/blog/openai-announces-leadership-transition |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231117212221/https://openai.com/blog/openai-announces-leadership-transition |archive-date=17 November 2023 |access-date=2023-11-17 |website=openai.com |language=en-US}}{{Cite web |last=Peters |first=Jay |date=2023-11-17 |title=Sam Altman fired as CEO of OpenAI |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/11/17/23965982/openai-ceo-sam-altman-fired |access-date=2023-11-17 |website=The Verge |language=en |archive-date=17 November 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231117205233/https://www.theverge.com/2023/11/17/23965982/openai-ceo-sam-altman-fired |url-status=live }}{{Cite news |last=Mickle |first=Tripp |last2=Metz |first2=Cade |date=2023-11-17 |title=Meet Mira Murati, the Engineer Now Leading OpenAI |language=en-US |work=The New York Times |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2023/11/17/technology/mira-murati-openai.html |access-date=2023-11-18 |issn=0362-4331 |archive-date=18 November 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231118031422/https://www.nytimes.com/2023/11/17/technology/mira-murati-openai.html |url-status=live }} She was replaced by [[Emmett Shear]] three days later, who was in turn replaced when Altman was reinstated five days after being ousted (after which Murati returned to her role as CTO).{{cite web |last1=Heath |first1=Alex |date=20 November 2023 |title=The deal to bring Sam Altman back to OpenAI has fallen apart |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/11/20/23967515/sam-altman-openai-board-fired-new-ceo |website=The Verge |language=en}}{{Cite news |last=Metz |first=Cade |last2=Isaac |first2=Mike |last3=Mickle |first3=Tripp |last4=Weise |first4=Karen |last5=Roose |first5=Kevin |date=2023-11-22 |title=Sam Altman Is Reinstated as OpenAI’s Chief Executive |language=en-US |work=The New York Times |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2023/11/22/technology/openai-sam-altman-returns.html |access-date=2023-11-22 |issn=0362-4331}} ==Previous Career== Murati briefly worked for [[Zodiac Aerospace]] before joining electric car company [[Tesla, Inc.|Tesla]] in 2013, where she was instrumental in the development of the Model X. From 2016 until joining OpenAI in 2018, she worked for augmented reality start-up [[Leap Motion]] (now [[Ultraleap]]).{{Cite news |last=Murgia |first=Madhumita |date=2023-06-18 |title=OpenAI's Mira Murati: the woman charged with pushing generative AI into the real world |work=Financial Times |url=https://www.ft.com/content/73f9686e-12cd-47bc-aa6e-52054708b3b3 |url-status=live |access-date=2023-07-04 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230704120600/https://www.ft.com/content/73f9686e-12cd-47bc-aa6e-52054708b3b3 |archive-date=4 July 2023}}{{Cite web |last1=Robison |first1=Kylie |last2=Lev-Ram |first2=Michal |date=October 5, 2023 |title=Mira Murati, the young CTO of OpenAI, is building ChatGPT and shaping your future |url=https://fortune.com/longform/openai-mira-murati-chatgpt-dalle-3-generative-ai-agi/ |url-access=subscription |url-status=live |archive-url=http://archive.today/2023.10.05-112536/https://fortune.com/longform/openai-mira-murati-chatgpt-dalle-3-generative-ai-agi/ |archive-date=October 5, 2023 |work=[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]}}{{Cite web |last=Barr |first=Lollie |title=Mira Murati |url=https://digitalmag.theceomagazine.com/mira-murati/ |access-date=2023-12-18 |website=CEO Magazine |language=en-US}}{{Cite news |date=2023-02-10 |title=Mira Murati, CTO of ChatGPT company OpenAI has a 'warning' |work=The Times of India |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/gadgets-news/mira-murati-cto-of-chatgpt-company-openai-has-a-warning/articleshow/97808422.cms |access-date=2023-12-18 |issn=0971-8257}} ==Publications== *Murati, Ermira. [https://www.amacad.org/publication/language-coding-creativity Language & Coding Creativity], Dædalus, Spring 2022 ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{Twitter}} {{Wikiquote}} {{OpenAI navbox}} {{Existential risk from artificial intelligence}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Murati, Mira}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1988 births]] [[Category:People from Vlorë]] [[Category:Albanian emigrants to the United States]] [[Category:Albanian inventors]] [[Category:Albanian engineers]] [[Category:American people of Albanian descent]] [[Category:People educated at a United World College]] [[Category:Colby College alumni]] [[Category:Thayer School of Engineering alumni]] [[Category:Dartmouth College alumni]] [[Category:Artificial intelligence ethicists]] [[Category:American women engineers]] [[Category:Tesla, Inc. people]] [[Category:OpenAI]] [[Category:American technology executives]] [[Category:Chief technology officers]]
